body_html:
I am amazing that this is not responded. The documentation of torch.max says:

>> a = torch.randn(4, 4)
>> a

0.0692  0.3142  1.2513 -0.5428
0.9288  0.8552 -0.2073  0.6409
1.0695 -0.0101 -2.4507 -1.2230
0.7426 -0.7666  0.4862 -0.6628
torch.FloatTensor of size 4x4]

>>> torch.max(a, 1)
(
 1.2513
 0.9288
 1.0695
 0.7426
[torch.FloatTensor of size 4]
,
 2
 0
 0
 0
[torch.LongTensor of size 4]
)

But I reproduced this code in PyTorch v0.1.12, the size of the results changed:

>> a = torch.randn(4, 4)
>> a

-1.8528 -2.6025  0.7865 -0.9720
-0.5096  1.2832  0.9036  0.6411
 0.3368 -0.1593  0.0521  0.4321
 0.8267  0.0115  0.7012  2.3030
[torch.FloatTensor of size 4x4]

>> torch.max(a, 1)

(
  0.7865
  1.2832
  0.4321
  2.3030
 [torch.FloatTensor of size 4x1], 
  2
  1
  3
  3
 [torch.LongTensor of size 4x1])

I watched the same phenomenon for min.

Is the documentation outdated? Or is it just a bug? @soumith

body:
I am amazing that this is not responded. The [documentation](http://pytorch.org/docs/master/torch.html#torch.max) of `torch.max` says:

```
>> a = torch.randn(4, 4)
>> a

0.0692  0.3142  1.2513 -0.5428
0.9288  0.8552 -0.2073  0.6409
1.0695 -0.0101 -2.4507 -1.2230
0.7426 -0.7666  0.4862 -0.6628
torch.FloatTensor of size 4x4]

>>> torch.max(a, 1)
(
 1.2513
 0.9288
 1.0695
 0.7426
[torch.FloatTensor of size 4]
,
 2
 0
 0
 0
[torch.LongTensor of size 4]
)
```

But I reproduced this code in PyTorch v0.1.12, the size of the results changed:

```
>> a = torch.randn(4, 4)
>> a

-1.8528 -2.6025  0.7865 -0.9720
-0.5096  1.2832  0.9036  0.6411
 0.3368 -0.1593  0.0521  0.4321
 0.8267  0.0115  0.7012  2.3030
[torch.FloatTensor of size 4x4]

>> torch.max(a, 1)

(
  0.7865
  1.2832
  0.4321
  2.3030
 [torch.FloatTensor of size 4x1], 
  2
  1
  3
  3
 [torch.LongTensor of size 4x1])
```

I watched the same phenomenon for `min`.

Is the documentation outdated? Or is it just a bug? @soumith
